intro: Myrsine pellucidostriata, commonly known as the translucent-striped myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that have a distinctive translucent striation pattern along the midrib. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and are followed by small, red berries. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides.
